## Exponents and Logarithms

### Properties of Exponentials

$$ 
x^ax^b = x^{a+b} \\
\dfrac{x^a}{x^b} = x^{a-b} \\
x^a = e^{a log(x)} \\
(x^{a})^b = x^{ab} \\
x^{-a} = \dfrac{1}{x^a} 
$$

## Exponents and Logarithms

### Properties of Logarithms
$$
log(x^a) = a log(x) \\
log(ab) = log(a) + log(b) \\
log\left(\dfrac{a}{b}\right) = log(a) - log(b)
$$
